description.narrative: Capacity of Government and civil society to provide alternative non-formal educational services for out-of-school adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, is strengthened, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Empowerment (Covid), Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescent Health And Nutrition (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescents and youth, in particular girls and the most vulnerable, contribute to the creation and benefit from services of reproductive health, education, training, and information

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Children and adolescent participating in the planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of UNICEF programmes
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Government and civil society to provide alternative non-formal educational services for out-of-school adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, is strengthened

description.narrative: To achieve this output, activities were carried out at diffent levels such: preparation of guiding documents in the context of implementing the recommendations of the Out of School Study and the Cause of Early Pregnancy Study; carrying out advocacy for resource mobilization for implementation of the activities of the Early Pregnancy Prevention Plan. Also Youth Institute capacity building is ongoing with the elaboration of the Youth Ation Plan and human resourses training to coordinate the implementation of the National Youth Strategy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of trainers skilled to provide alternative non-formal educational services
Number of IP assessed and trained on PSEA

Number of IEC actions carried out (all sessions combined) with parents, teachers and student associations as part of the prevention of early pregnancy and the protection of the rights of pregnant girls
Percentage of district covered with PSEA sensitization activities

Number of adolescent girls and boys who participate in or lead civic engagement (including online) in UNICEF-supported programmes for COVID-19 preparedness, response and building back better (more resilient, peaceful, greener and sustainable) in the reporting year [COVID]
Availability of new training material for out-of-school adolescents
